books, comics, queen and skam remakes

this blog is a mess and so am i

summary:
Important thing I noticed in the SKAM France season 2 finale that was different from the OG season 2 finale:
“I’m moving in with...
body:
Important thing I noticed in the SKAM France season 2 finale that was different from the OG season 2 finale:

“I’m moving in with Charles. But my parents don’t need to know that. They are going to keep paying for this place.”

Not only did manon suggest that Lucas moves into her old flat, but she’s not even going to make him pay for it. Manon barley even knew Lucas and still saw what he was through and helped him out. And you know what? God damn it. God damn manon for being such an amazing character. I love her so freaking much.

This scene goes along with one of my other favorite moments from season two. It’s when manon sees Lucas arguing on the phone and says that even though they don’t know each other well, she was there if he needed it. The Noora/Isak friendship was one I always wished we would get to see more of and I’m really hoping that SKAM France continues to supply it because it honestly warms my heart.

blog.name: shadeandadidas
blog.title: i have loved you for the last time
blog.description: Jill. 22. NYU class of 2019. Talk to me💙

summary: hiiii i keep seeing posts about skam on my dash and i really wanna start it but sometimes its tagged just 'skam' and sometimes...
question: hiiii i keep seeing posts about skam on my dash and i really wanna start it but sometimes its tagged just 'skam' and sometimes its tagged 'skam italia' and i just saw 'skam french'... can u pls help a confused girl understand whats going on/what she should watch exactly... tysm
answer:
oh, Anon, I can only imagine the confusion hahaha. But welcome to the skam universe and let’s get you settled in, shall we? 

So the original show is called ‘SKAM’. It’s a Norwegian show about a group of high schoolers. Every season focused on a different teenager and a different set of universal issues. However, all of the characters intertwine in satisfying ways.

After the meteoric rise in success of SKAM, a multitude of different countries decided to remake it for their own languages and audiences. Same general stories so far, different actors and languages. So when you see something tagged ‘skam italia’, we are talking about the Italian version of the show or ‘Skam France’ is the french version of the show. 

I am a big proponent that everyone should start with the original norwegian ‘SKAM’. However, if you want the experience of watching a current season in real time, Skam Italia is where I should start you. Let me know what you want to do (or if you have a specific language you speak and want to know if your country has done a version of it.) I’ll send you the right links.

summary: I feel like French evak will be soulmates because their hair already is. It’s so fluffy because it’s full of secrets and repels...
question: I feel like French evak will be soulmates because their hair already is. It’s so fluffy because it’s full of secrets and repels heterosexuality. Hairmates (tm), you heard it here first!
answer:
I just snorted so loudly oh my god. For real though, those little fuzzy hedgehogs clearly belong together. 

Look all i want is for someone to treat Lucas right. He, out of all of the Isaks I’ve seen in the remakes, seems the lonliest and the saddest. He looks like he’s had all the fight drained out of him. I just want Elliot to sweep in there and cheer him up and pay him some attention.

blog.name: sivis2016
blog.title: Not Really A Blog
blog.description: Just some thoughts

summary:
Isak and Even's first meetings were supposed to be awkward. For me that was so nice and relatable..lol. 
Isak did always seem so...
body:
Isak and Even’s first meetings were supposed to be awkward. For me that was so nice and relatable..lol.

Isak did always seem so confident and cocky around girls, but with Even he just totally lost his skills and he became a shy mess. It was so cute:)) Some people become shy and awkward around people they really really like, and others just act more of a blabbering mess..lol..both is very understandable and a pretty normal reaction if you ask me.

In the tram scene you can basically SEE the running thoughts in Isak’s head, like ‘please find something funny or cool to say, just don’t stand here acting like a total idiot’ LOL it was just so adorable and relatable;))

Isak and Even’s chemistry and attraction was there from the very first look, and their bonding scene over weed and music is still one of my favorite scenes, so damn good😍it just felt so real and authentic. And it was also a blessing to watch Isak really relax and be himself with Even. They just clicked and they both felt it.

Gahhh…just writing this made me miss them so so much😭😭

I actually think all the remakes are doing fine in their own way, but I’m not that invested in any of them. For me it’s just hard to get those old Skam feelings back, probably because some of the original characters really stole my heart ❤️ Still enjoying the remakes though👌

summary: Wait, there aren’t canteens or cafeterias at schools in Italia? Oh, i find it interesting. I mean, we too have lunch break and...
body:
Wait, there aren’t canteens or cafeterias at schools in Italia? Oh, i find it interesting. I mean, we too have lunch break and all and some students go home, eat their lunch and go back, but we also canteens at schools in Turkey; although cafeterias are rarer.

Care to explain italian fellas? And people from other countries, how’s the system at your schools?

summary: throwback to when the french and italian remakes were first announced and us french and italians were debating which would be...
body:
throwback to when the french and italian remakes were first announced and us french and italians were debating which would be the worst, agreeing already that both would be awful anyway

…

skamit sure surprised us, eh?
